instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00875: What is 820-00875? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning one.
threads.message:
The board was water damage in <CHIP>U8400</CHIP> area. So checked all rails and found that <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is shorted to ground. Checked all components on that line and all seems be ok. Injecting 3V only CPU points where arrives <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>  is getting hot. 


CPU is dead or there is something else i can check?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning one.
threads.message: If CPU heats, nothing more to say...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning one.
threads.message: so nothing more to check, right?
